    startGame(String gameMode)
    Starts up game screen with the selected gamemode If the current session's list doesn't contain the selected gamemode, it gets added to the list If there is a savefile in the saves directory to the selected gamemode, it gets loaded instead of an empty board

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

    • createAllGUIs

      private static void createAllGUIs()
      Creates the main frame, and it's panel with a cardlayout. It adds all the windows to said cardlayout, so the program can switch between them later on. Sets some of the frame's default settings, it's starting size, starting position, etc. The program needs to know when the frame gets resized (for relative sizing and positioning) / closed (for saving), therefore these listeners also get added to the frame.
      See Also:
      • createStartScreen()
      • createEndScreen()
      • createGamePanel(String)
      • saveProgress()
      • showStartScreen()

    • saveProgress

      private static void saveProgress()
      If the hasn't ended but the program still exited, the function saves the board's current state and remove the current mode's name from a list, which keeps track of the gamemodes that have been played this session, so that way it won't delete that gamemode's savefile.
      See Also:
      • SaveSystem.saveGame(GameState, String)
      • SaveSystem.deleteSavedGame(String)

    • loadProgress

      private static GameState loadProgress(String filename)
      If the saves directory contains a savefile for the given gamemode, it gets loaded.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the gamemode - PVE or PVP
      See Also:
      • SaveSystem.loadGame(String)

    • createStartScreen

      private static JPanel createStartScreen()
      Creates the screen where the user chooses which mode to play The screen - startPanel - gets assigned a title and another panel - modePanel The latter panel gets assigned buttons, and those buttons get actionlisteners
      See Also:
      • createMenuButton(String)

    • createGamePanel

      private static CoinPanel createGamePanel(String mode)
      The screen where the game will be played gets created The game panel gets the BoardClickListener that has been created in a seperate class
      Parameters:
      mode - The selected gamemode

    • createEndScreen

      private static JPanel createEndScreen()
      Creates the screen that shows when the game ends The panel gets buttons with actionlisteners added to it The panel also has a panel, which receives a property so it can be manipulated later

    • createMenuButton

      private static JButton createMenuButton(String title)
      Generic button creator for the gamemode selecting screen
      Parameters:
      title - The button will be assigned this title

    • showStartScreen

      public static void showStartScreen()
      Changes the frame's screen to the gamemode selection screen

    • showGameScreen

      public static void showGameScreen()
      Changes the frame's screen to the game's screen

    • endScreenDelay

      public static void endScreenDelay(int time, String winnerMessage)
      Parameters:
      time - The delay which after the ending screen will be shown
      winnerMessage - The message that's going to be displayed on the ending screen

    • showEndScreen

      public static void showEndScreen(String winnerMessage)
      Changes the main frame's screen to the ending screen
      Parameters:
      winnerMessage - The message that's going to be displayed

    • startGame

      private static void startGame(String gameMode)
      Starts up game screen with the selected gamemode If the current session's list doesn't contain the selected gamemode, it gets added to the list If there is a savefile in the saves directory to the selected gamemode, it gets loaded instead of an empty board
      Parameters:
      gameMode - The selected gamemode - PVP/PVE
      See Also:
      • loadProgress(String)
      • createGamePanel(String)
      • showGameScreen()
      • CoinPanel.loadFromState(GameState)

    • restartGame

      private static void restartGame()
      Triggers the game starting function, with the last selected gamemode
      See Also:
      • startGame(String)
